post_text: Ms. Courtright and Ms. McCrea’s 7th & 8th grade science students had the opportunity to use a Van de Graaff generator and discuss some things they have learned this year. A Van de Graaf generator is an electrostatic generator which uses a moving belt to accumulate an electric charge on a hollow metal globe on the top of an insulated column. It produces direct current electricity at low levels. It was invented by American physicist Robert J. Van de Graaff in 1929. Small Van de Graaff machines like this are used for physics education; this same machine was used by both Ms. Courtright and Ms. McCrea when they were students.
